DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Negation Discontinue Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response that indicates whether the patient is able to discontinue prohibited medications to meet clinical trial eligibility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Negation Discontinue Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.preferredName: Negation Discontinue Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient unable to discontinue prohibited medications or herbal preparations within 7 days of enrollment and within 14 days of starting study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient unable to disc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient unable to discontinue prohibited medications or herbal preparations within 7 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient unable to discontinue medications or substances that are strong inhibitors, inducers or sensitive substrates of CYP3A4/5 or CYP2C19 prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient unable to discontinue medications or substances that are strong inhibitors, inducers or sensitive substrates of CYP3A4/5, CYP2C19, or CYP2C9  or substrates of CYP1A2, CYP2B6, or CYP3A4/5 with a narrow therapeutic prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient discontinue prednisone or its equivalent fourteen (14) days prior to enrollment unless otherwise indicated in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient received <0.5 mg/kg/day of prednisone equivalent averaged during the month prior to enrollment, was patient able to discontinue it fourteen (14) days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient received less than 0.5 mg/kg/day of prednisone equivalent averaged during the month prior to enrollment, was patient able to discontinue it fourteen (14) days prior to enrollment?
